task.title: Building WebDriverAgent for real iOS devices with Appium 2.0 and Xcode 14

li.p: You have installed Appium XCUITest Driver. See .

taskbody.context: If you are using Appium 2.0 and Xcode 14 to run mobile tests with real iOS devices, you need to manually install WebDriverAgent on Xcode.

step.cmd: Open Xcode. In Xcode > Preferences > Account, click Add (+) to enter your Apple Developer Account ID and password.
After installing the Appium XCUITest Driver, navigate to the WebDriverAgent folder in this directory: /Users/<username>/.appium/node_modules/appium-xcuitest-driver/node_modules/appium-webdriveragent
step.info: Double-click on the WebDriverAgent.xcodeproj file in the selected folder to open it in Xcode.

step.cmd: Build the IntegrationApp target with the following steps:

substep.cmd: Select the IntegrationApp target. In the Signing & Capabilities section, check the Automatically manage signing box, then choose a team added in Step 1.
On the menu bar, select Product > Build.

step.cmd: Build the WebDriverAgentLib target with the following steps:

substep.cmd: Select the WebDriverAgentLib target. In the Signing & Capabilities section, check the Automatically manage signing box, then choose a team added in Step 1.
On the menu bar, select Product > Build.

step.cmd: Build the WebDriverAgentRunner target with the following steps:

substep.cmd: Select the WebDriverAgentRunner target. In the Signing & Capabilities section, check the Automatically manage signing box, then choose a team added in Step 1.
On the menu bar, select Product > Build.

taskbody.result: You have successfully installed the WebDriverAgent manually.
